019package org.jgrapes.util;
020
021import java.math.BigDecimal;
022import java.time.Instant;
023import java.time.format.DateTimeParseException;
024import java.util.ArrayList;
025import java.util.Collection;
026import java.util.HashMap;
027import java.util.List;
028import java.util.Map;
029import java.util.Optional;
030import java.util.StringTokenizer;
031import java.util.TreeMap;
032import java.util.regex.Pattern;
033import java.util.stream.Collectors;
034import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
035import org.jgrapes.core.Component;
036import org.jgrapes.core.Event;
037import org.jgrapes.core.Manager;
038import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.Handler;
039import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.HandlerDefinition.ChannelReplacements;
040import org.jgrapes.util.events.InitialConfiguration;
041
042/**
043 * A base class for configuration stores. Implementing classes must
044 * override one of the methods {@link #structured(String)} or
045 * {@link #values(String)} as the default implementations of either
046 * calls the other. 
047 */
048@SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
049public abstract class ConfigurationStore extends Component {
050
051    public static final Pattern NUMBER = Pattern.compile("^\\d+$");
052
053    /**
054     * Creates a new component with its channel set to itself.
055     */
056    public ConfigurationStore() {
057        // Nothing to do.
058    }
059
060    /**
061     * Creates a new component base with its channel set to the given 
062     * channel. As a special case {@link Channel#SELF} can be
063     * passed to the constructor to make the component use itself
064     * as channel. The special value is necessary as you 
065     * obviously cannot pass an object to be constructed to its 
066     * constructor.
067     *
068     * @param componentChannel the channel that the component's
069     * handlers listen on by default and that 
070     * {@link Manager#fire(Event, Channel...)} sends the event to
071     */
072    public ConfigurationStore(Channel componentChannel) {
073        super(componentChannel);
074    }
075
076    /**
077     * Creates a new component base like {@link #ConfigurationStore(Channel)}
078     * but with channel mappings for {@link Handler} annotations.
079     *
080     * @param componentChannel the channel that the component's
081     * handlers listen on by default and that 
082     * {@link Manager#fire(Event, Channel...)} sends the event to
083     * @param channelReplacements the channel replacements to apply
084     * to the `channels` elements of the {@link Handler} annotations
085     */
086    public ConfigurationStore(Channel componentChannel,
087            ChannelReplacements channelReplacements) {
088        super(componentChannel, channelReplacements);
089    }
090
091    /**
092     * Configuration information should be kept simple. Sometimes, 
093     * however, it is unavoidable to structure the information 
094     * associated with a (logical) key. This can be done by 
095     * reflecting the structure in the names of actual keys, derived
096     * from the logical key. Names such as "key.0", "key.1", "key.2" 
097     * can be used to express that the value associated with "key" 
098     * is a list of values. "key.a", "key.b", "key.c" can be used 
099     * to associate "key" with a map from "a", "b", "c" to some values.
100     * 
101     * This methods looks at all values in the mapped passed as
102     * argument. If the value is a collection or map, the entry is
103     * converted to several entries following the pattern outlined
104     * above.
105     *
106     * @param structured the map with possibly structured properties
107     * @return the map with flattened properties
108     */
109    public static Map<String, Object> flatten(Map<String, ?> structured) {
110        @SuppressWarnings("PMD.UseConcurrentHashMap")
111        Map<String, Object> result = new HashMap<>();
112        flattenObject(result, null, structured);
113        return result;
114    }
115
116    @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "PMD.AvoidDuplicateLiterals" })
117    private static void flattenObject(Map<String, Object> result,
118            String prefix, Object value) {
119        if (value instanceof Map) {
120            for (var entry : ((Map<Object, Object>) value).entrySet()) {
121                if (entry.getKey().toString().startsWith("/")) {
122                    continue;
123                }
124                flattenObject(result,
125                    Optional.ofNullable(prefix).map(p -> p + ".").orElse("")
126                        + entry.getKey(),
127                    entry.getValue());
128            }
129            return;
130        }
131        if (value instanceof Collection) {
132            int count = 0;
133            for (var item : (Collection<?>) value) {
134                flattenObject(result, prefix + "." + count++, item);
135            }
136            return;
137        }
138        result.put(prefix, value);
139    }
140
141    /**
142     * Same as {@link #structure(Map, boolean)} with `false` as
143     * second argument.
144     *
145     * @param flatProperties the flat properties
146     * @return a map with structured values
147     */
148    @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops",
149        "PMD.ReturnEmptyCollectionRatherThanNull" })
150    public static Map<String, Object> structure(Map<String, ?> flatProperties) {
151        return structure(flatProperties, false);
152    }
153
154    /**
155     * The reverse operation to {@link #flatten(Map)}. Entries with
156     * key names matching the pattern outlined in {@link #flatten(Map)}
157     * are combined to a single entry with a structured value (list or
158     * map).
159     * 
160     * If `convertSparse` is `true` incomplete index sets such as
161     * `key.2`, `key.3`, `key.5` are converted to lists with the
162     * available number of elements. Else, keys with consecutive
163     * indices starting with 0 must be provided. Otherwise the
164     * entries are converted to a {@link Map} with keys of type
165     * {@link Integer}.
166     *
167     * @param flatProperties the flat properties
168     * @param convertSparse controls conversion to lists
169     * @return a map with structured values
170     */
171    @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops",
172        "PMD.ReturnEmptyCollectionRatherThanNull" })
173    public static Map<String, Object>
174            structure(Map<String, ?> flatProperties, boolean convertSparse) {
175        if (flatProperties == null) {
176            return null;
177        }
178        @SuppressWarnings("PMD.UseConcurrentHashMap")
179        Map<Object, Object> result = new HashMap<>();
180        for (var entry : flatProperties.entrySet()) {
181            @SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
182            Map<Object, Object> target = result;
183            // Original key (optionally) consists of dot separated parts
184            StringTokenizer parts = new StringTokenizer(entry.getKey(), ".");
185            while (true) {
186                var part = parts.nextToken();
187                Object key = NUMBER.matcher(part).find()
188                    ? Integer.parseInt(part)
189                    : part;
190                if (!parts.hasMoreTokens()) {
191                    // Last part (of key), store value
192                    target.put(key, entry.getValue());
193                    break;
194                }
195                @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
196                var newTarget = (Map<Object, Object>) target
197                    .computeIfAbsent(part, k -> new TreeMap<Object, Object>());
198                target = newTarget;
199            }
200        }
201
202        // Now convert all maps that have only Integer keys to lists
203        for (var entry : result.entrySet()) {
204            entry.setValue(maybeConvert(entry.getValue(), convertSparse));
205        }
206
207        // Return result
208        @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "rawtypes" })
209        Map<String, Object> res = (Map<String, Object>) (Map) result;
210        return res;
211    }
212
213    @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "PMD.ConfusingTernary" })
214    private static Object maybeConvert(Object value, boolean convertSparse) {
215        if (!(value instanceof TreeMap)) {
216            return value;
217        }
218        List<Object> converted = new ArrayList<>();
219        for (var entry : ((Map<Object, Object>) value).entrySet()) {
220            entry.setValue(maybeConvert(entry.getValue(), convertSparse));
221            if (converted == null) {
222                continue;
223            }
224            if (!(entry.getKey() instanceof Integer)
225                || !convertSparse
226                    && ((Integer) entry.getKey()) != converted.size()) {
227                // Don't convert, leave as Map.
228                converted = null;
229                continue;
230            }
231            converted.add(entry.getValue());
232        }
233        return converted != null ? converted : value;
234    }
235
236    /**
237     * Return the values for a given path if they exists. This
238     * method should only be used in cases where configuration values
239     * are needed before the {@link InitialConfiguration} event is
240     * fired, e.g. while creating the component tree. 
241     * 
242     * @param path the path
243     * @return the values, if defined for the given path
244     */
245    public Optional<Map<String, String>> values(String path) {
246        return structured(path).map(ConfigurationStore::flatten)
247            .map(o -> o.entrySet().stream()
248                .collect(Collectors.toMap(Map.Entry::getKey,
249                    e -> e.getValue().toString())));
250    }
251
252    /**
253     * Return the properties for a given path if they exists
254     * as structured data. 
255     * 
256     * @param path the path
257     * @return the values, if defined for the given path
258     */
259    public Optional<Map<String, Object>> structured(String path) {
260        return values(path).map(ConfigurationStore::structure);
261    }
262
263    /**
264     * If the value is not `null`, return it as the requested type.
265     * The method is successful if the value already is of the
266     * requested type (or a subtype) or if the value is of type
267     * {@link String} and can be converted to the requested type. 
268     * 
269     * Supported types are:
270     * * {@link String}
271     * * {@link Number}
272     * 
273     * @return the value
274     */
275    @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "PMD.ShortMethodName" })
276    public static <T> Optional<T> as(Object value, Class<T> requested) {
277        // Handle null.
278        if (value == null) {
279            return Optional.empty();
280        }
281        // Is of requested type?
282        if (requested.isAssignableFrom(value.getClass())) {
283            return Optional.of((T) value);
284        }
285        // Convert to String, if requested.
286        if (requested.equals(String.class)) {
287            return Optional.of((T) value.toString());
288        }
289        // Remaining conversions require a string representation.
290        if (!(value instanceof String)) {
291            return Optional.empty();
292        }
293        if (requested.equals(Number.class)) {
294            try {
295                return Optional.of((T) new BigDecimal((String) value));
296            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
297                return Optional.empty();
298            }
299        }
300        if (requested.equals(Instant.class)) {
301            try {
302                return Optional.of((T) Instant.parse((String) value));
303            } catch (DateTimeParseException e) {
304                return Optional.empty();
305            }
306        }
307        if (requested.equals(Boolean.class)) {
308            return Optional.of((T) Boolean.valueOf((String) value));
309        }
310        return Optional.empty();
311    }
312
313}
